There are times in which we are introduced to folks that had just brief passing interactions with the Lord Jesus Christ, and there are times in which we find that some of the characters that were introduced to throughout the gospel records, they had multiple interactions, prolonged interactions with the Lord Jesus Christ, and we find that as we would go to these texts of scripture, that there are times in which we will find some of these characters that are more well-known than others. Zacchaeus, you've been coming here all the time taking tax money from me. He was a chief amongst the publicans. He wasn't new at this game. No doubt, he was known amongst the people. Zacchaeus, what happened to you? Let me tell you what happened to me. Jesus was coming through Jericho, and I wanted to see who he was. There were so many people, I couldn't see him. So I ran up, and I got up into a tree. And you know, Jesus stopped, and he spoke my name, and he said he was gonna come to my house. And he changed my life. That's the testimony of this man. But you have a testimony too. And I think this evening that Zacchaeus probably talked about this quite a bit. I mean, He's just excited about being saved. And I believe this evening that there are probably people in heaven today because of the testimony of Zacchaeus. I believe that. And I wonder tonight, how many people are in heaven because of my testimony? How many people are in heaven because of your testimony? I mean, do we really see and understand what Christ has done for us? I understand you might not have climbed in a tree, I get it. But there was a day that you got saved. And we ought to talk about that day, and we ought to share with people, because listen, there are people like Zacchaeus that you come into contact with. Oh, they have the position, they have the possessions, but they're empty. And we can relate to Zacchaeus in both the beginning and the end of the passage that we look at. And I want to be challenged this evening to be faithful in sharing my testimony and sharing with others what Christ did for me, because He changed my life. And if you're saved tonight, He changed your life. And those people that Zacchaeus interacted with, I'm just bringing you money back that I took wrongly. Can you imagine? You're what? Yeah. God changed my life, and He can change your life too. Let's pray. Father, we love You. Thank You for loving us. I pray that You would work in hearts and lives tonight as only You can. We see how this man is described and what he desires, and we see what Christ declared. God, I'm challenged tonight, personally. I think I'm challenged as much tonight as I was just a few weeks ago when You just stopped me in this passage of Scripture. Lord, I pray You'd help us tonight to rejoice in our salvation, to rejoice in knowing that You are the seeking Savior. Help us to be challenged tonight, to share our testimony. I wonder if we really would allow that question to probe our hearts, to be honest about answering that question. How many people are in heaven because of my testimony? You've called us to be Your ambassadors. You've commissioned us to go and to preach the gospel to every creature. I pray the Holy Spirit of God would have His will in way this night. First, in Christ's name we pray, would You stand with me, heads are bowed, eyes are closed.

segments.text: and I'll be looking at a passage of scripture, really a character that God
gives us the opportunity to read about from this text of scripture that is
familiar to many of us. In fact, I am going to guarantee this evening that the
youngest among us are going to know this character, right? James up here, he's gonna
know, and Zachary and Natalie, they're gonna know the character, and they're
gonna be excited about it, and I'm sure that many of you will know him as well.
As we look at Luke chapter 19, we're gonna look at verses 1 through 10. The
title of the message is this, A Man Named Zacchaeus. James, do you know who Zacchaeus
is? Zacchaeus was a wee little man, amen? And so I told you they'd know Zacchaeus,
right? Natalie and Zachary, you guys know about Zacchaeus, you sing the song, and
you've heard this passage of scripture, no doubt, as you've had the opportunity
in Sunday School, Children's Church, Awana, whatever, maybe at home, in the car,
sometimes, maybe too often for the parents liking, singing the song over and
over and over, but the reality is that as we look and study the Word of God,
especially as we read through the gospel accounts here, we find that God gives us
the opportunity to be introduced to a number of people. There are times in
which we are introduced to folks that had just brief passing interactions with
the Lord Jesus Christ, and there are times in which we find that some of the
characters that were introduced to throughout the gospel records, they had
multiple interactions, prolonged interactions with the Lord Jesus Christ,
and we find that as we would go to these texts of scripture, that there are times
in which we will find some of these characters that are more well-known than
others. Of course, when we think about Zacchaeus and this particular text of
scripture, again, he's a Bible character that is known by many, and I think
mostly because of the song that is sung about him and about his life, and we find
here in Luke 19, I want to read the first couple of verses, we'll get into the
study this evening. The Bible says this,
"...and Jesus entered and passed through Jericho." And it says this in verse number
two, "...and behold, there was a man named Zacchaeus, which was the chief among the
publicans, and he was rich." Look at verse number 10, skip down if
you will. The Bible says in verse number 10, "...for the Son of Man," speaking of
Jesus, "...is come to seek and to save that which was lost." As we look at this
passage of scripture, we've titled the message, A Man Named Zacchaeus. If you're
taking notes this evening, I want you to notice first how Zacchaeus is described.
Notice how the scriptures describe this man to us. We find that the Bible begins
in verse number one by telling us about Jesus, who would enter and pass through
Jericho. Now, we understand the fact that Jesus had folks that were well aware of
his life and ministry. In fact, as you study the life of Christ, you'll find
that on a number of occasion, there are people that desired to go and be where
Jesus was. They wanted to hear him teach. Mainly, they wanted to receive the
bread, the miracles, be partakers of those things. And we find here that in verse
number one, that God sets the scene for us to tell us that Jesus was coming and
he was going to pass through Jericho. This is the home place of this one,
Zacchaeus, and thus we're introduced to Zacchaeus. And the Bible tells us this,
the description is given here in verse number two. Notice what it says, first of
all, that Zacchaeus, which was the chief among the publicans. I want you to notice
that in the first level of description that is given to us about this man,
Zacchaeus, is we're told about his position. We are told that this man,
Zacchaeus, was chief among the publicans. Now, no doubt if you've read the Gospels
and you've read about the interactions between the Jewish folks and the
publicans, the publicans were not well-liked. The publicans were tax
collectors, and they were tax collectors for the Roman government, and as such,
they would not have had a great deal of popularity amongst the Jewish people.
And we find that these tax collectors, they would, of course, be ridiculed and
looked down upon, but they did have a level of power, and they did have this
authority. And we find that the Bible says that this man, Zacchaeus, as we're
introduced to him, as we're reading the description of him, that he was the chief
among the publicans. I want you to understand that though he might not have
been popular amongst the Jewish people, that this man prospered in his position.
This man had position. And the Bible ends in verse number two by saying this,
and he was rich. Not only did he have position, but this man had possession.
And we find that as we would look at the description of this man as it's given to
us in verse number two, this man Zacchaeus, that we're told that he is
chief among the publicans, that he has this position. We're told that he is rich,
that he has these possessions. As James told us to begin the study this evening,
that Zacchaeus was a wee little man, we read in verse number three that he
sought to see Jesus, who he was, and could not for the press notice because he was
little of stature. And so he was little of stature. We see that description given
to us in verse number three. But I want you to focus upon these first two
elements that are given to us in verse number two with regard to how this man
is described. And I want you to understand something when we enter into
this passage of Scripture. I want you to understand this evening that there are a
number of people that may not have the name Zacchaeus, but fit the description
of Zacchaeus. They may not have that name. In fact, I've never met an individual
named Zacchaeus. I don't know if you have, but I've never met... I didn't go to school
with anyone named Zacchaeus. I never went to Bible college with anyone named Zacchaeus.
I've never met somebody named Zacchaeus. But I would say to you this
evening that when we notice how this man is described in verse number two as
having position and having possession, that there are many today that fit the
the same characteristics as this man Zacchaeus. In fact, there are many
today that they strive to have what Zacchaeus had. They're looking for
position. They're looking for possession. They believe that if they can get
position, if they can get possession, that it will bring some level of joy, that it
will bring some level of satisfaction in their lives. If I could just get that
promotion. Oh, but you didn't know that with that promotion comes a whole lot of
headache, a whole lot of responsibility. But we think we want that
position. Oh, if I could have those possessions, if I could just have that,
whatever that thing is, it would bring me some level of satisfaction. And we live
in the midst of a generation that are seeking position and possession. And as
we look at the description of Zacchaeus, we find that this could describe your

could describe a family member, someone that's looking for position, that's
